EmailTemplate.name: RE: MBO support for Latticeworks - follow-up (1369234941.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO support for Latticeworks - follow-up (1369234941.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Clelia, Good go hear from you and nice to “meet” you Michelle. I am excited to see things are moving along and I would love to set up a time to chat this week to address the concerns below and catch up. After we speak I would like to schedule an individual call with Michelle so I can walk her through the MBO program and provide her with an estimate. You may easily book a time that is convenient for you on my online schedule by going here <https://my.timedriver.com/8SLYS>. Looking forward to it, Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Ask me about them. Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Clelia Peters [mailto:cleliapeters@gmail.com] Sent: Tuesday, May 21, 2013 6:28 PM To: Sara Conde; Michelle Knittel Cc: Aassia Haq Subject: MBO support for Latticeworks - follow-up Hi Sara, I hope this finds you well. I wanted to follow-up on our earlier discussions about working together to have you provide short-term benefits and back end services while Latticeworks scales up. While we still are not incorporated, Sallie (my co-founder) has just purchased a company which we can contract to and be paid through. I'd therefore like to re-initiate discussion! In addition to myself, I am now working with Michelle (included on this email) who I would also like to ensure has benefits and MBO services. Could we perhaps set up another call this week to discuss how we would begin working together? Finally, as I have been exploring the possibility of offering MBO services to the independent workers who would source work through Latticeworks a number of questions that have come up for me around both MBO's practices and the way that it might interact with the contracting model we are considering. These questions include:
- How does MBO handle the issue of payroll tax (do you pay it? Do the companies employing contractors pay it?)
- Will it be a tax issue if we have people working in a single role over a relatively lengthy period (eg 6-12 months)? Does this fundamentally contradict the IRS definition of contractual work?
- What if we place people in 'key function' roles over a limited period of time?
- Is it true that working more than 20 hours a week for 6 consecutive months for the same company triggers 'employment' as defined by the IRS? These questions could be resolved during our phone discussion or by email. I look forward to being back in touch. All the best,Clelia
